name: Imagine Montessori School (Valencia Campus)
stages: Early Years: Infant Community (20m–3y) and Children's House (3–6y). Valencia campus only; students transition to La Pinada for Primary onward.
curriculum: British National Curriculum (UK Department of Education & Skills) + Montessori pedagogy (AMI-inspired); recognised by the Spanish Ministry of Education
languages_day_to_day: English (vehicular language from 20 months); Spanish and Valencian introduced progressively from Primary onward
languages_taught: English, Spanish, Valencian (French added from Year 5 at La Pinada)
device_policy_summary: Montessori philosophy emphasises hands-on, concrete materials and sensory exploration in early years; minimal/no screen use at this campus (ages 20m–6y). No formal device policy published — contact school for details.
pedagogy: Montessori method (AMI-inspired): child-centred, prepared environments (100m²+ classrooms with 5 learning areas), mixed-age classrooms, self-directed learning, practical life skills, sensory work
micole_rating: 3.9 (listed under Imagine Montessori School Infantil on Micole)
fees_range: €831/month (Infant Community & Children's House, full day 9:00–16:40); €586/month (morning-only sessions for 2-year-olds); Admission fee: €2,100 first year; Re-enrolment: €395/year. Sibling discounts: 8.5% (2nd child), 20% (3rd child). 10 instalments/year. Meals included.
student_count: 350+ (across both campuses combined, per school's website)
special_notes: Two campuses: Valencia (ages 20m–6y) and La Pinada Paterna (ages 20m–18y). Valencia campus in northern Valencia, Rascanya/Alfahuir district, near huerta. Founded Sept 2016 by 3 Valencia families. All Valencia students guaranteed a place at La Pinada for Primary+. School bus available (€175/month return). Early bird (from 8am, €65/month) and Afternoon Club (until 18:00, €80/month) available. Secular, co-ed school. AMI-inspired Montessori. ~10 years of experience (as of 2025/26).

name: Imagine Montessori School (La Pinada Campus – Paterna)
neighborhood: Valterna / La Pinada (adjacent to En Dolça ravine and pine forest)
stages: Early Years (Infant Community 20m–3y, Children's House 3–6y), Primary (Year 1–6), Secondary (Year 7–11 / iGCSE), Sixth Form (Year 12–13 / A-Levels)
curriculum: British National Curriculum (UK Department of Education & Skills) + Montessori pedagogy (AMI-inspired); recognised by the Spanish Ministry of Education. Cambridge iGCSE and A-Level examinations at upper stages.
languages_day_to_day: English (vehicular language); Spanish and Valencian integrated from Primary; French introduced from Year 5
device_policy_summary: Montessori approach: screen-light in early years with hands-on concrete materials. No formal grade-by-grade device policy published — contact school for upper-stage specifics.
pedagogy: Montessori method (AMI-inspired) throughout all stages: child-centred, prepared environments, mixed-age classrooms, self-directed learning. Secondary includes science labs, art studio, Makers Lab, multimedia room, library/Learning Resource Centre. Sixth Form students access Zubi Labs co-working space for professional experience.
coords_confidence: approximate_paterna (Valterna edge, near En Dolça ravine)
fees_range: €831/month (Infant Community & Children's House); €890/month (Primary); €947/month (Year 7–9); €951/month (Year 10–11); €964/month (Year 12–13). Admission fee: €2,100 first year. Re-enrolment: €395/year. Sibling discounts: 8.5% (2nd), 20% (3rd). 10 instalments/year. Meals included. Additional: books & Cambridge exam fees for Year 10–13.
student_count: 350+ (across both campuses combined, per school's website)
special_notes: Main campus for full K–18 pathway. First school in Spain with BREEAM Excellent + Green Building Council 4 Leaves certification. 5,000m² sustainable building (S-shaped plan by Gradolí & Sanz Arquitectes, 2017–2019) set among pine trees adjacent to En Dolça ravine. 30,000m² total site. ~€4M investment. 70% energy savings vs. conventional buildings; landscaped roof; wood & clay construction. Children enter via elevated timber walkways through pine forest. New secondary/sixth form facilities under construction for 2025/26. Zubi Labs co-working hub for Year 12–13 students. Located ~8.6km from Valencia centre; school bus available. Secular, co-ed school. Founded by 3 Valencia families.

name: Deutsche Schule Valencia / Colegio Alemán de Valencia
address: Carrer de Jaume Roig 14-16, 46010 València, Valencia, Spain
neighborhood: Pla del Real / Jaume Roig (near Blasco Ibáñez university area)
stages: Kindergarten (Educación Infantil, ages 3–6), Grundschule/Primaria (Classes 1–4, ages 6–10), Sekundarstufe I (Classes 5–10, ages 10–16), Sekundarstufe II/Gymnasium (Classes 11–12, ages 16–18). Note: 'Rama C' entry pathway available for external students from 4th Primaria (Class 5) via free intensive German course with aptitude test (~25 places/year).
curriculum: German curriculum (Kultusministerkonferenz / KMK) leading to German Abitur; Spanish homologation for dual qualification (access to both German and Spanish universities). Certified 'Exzellente Deutsche Auslandsschule' by BLI (Bund-Länder-Inspektion). Free Selectividad (PCE) prep classes offered in Classes 11–12 (2 subjects included; additional subjects €50/semester each).
languages_day_to_day: German and Spanish are co-vehicular languages of instruction; English taught from Primary; French from Secondary
device_policy_summary: Digital media fee (Tasa cesión medios digitales) of €190/year applies for Classes 5–8, indicating school-issued devices from Class 5 onward. Contact school for full 1:1 device policy details in upper secondary.
pedagogy: German educational system (Begegnungsschule / 'encounter school' model): emphasis on academic rigour, bilingual German-Spanish development, intercultural understanding, and personal responsibility. High proportion of Spanish students alongside German nationals. Exchange programmes with schools in Germany and France. Music association and sports association actively connect students, parents, and alumni.
fees_range: €5,380–€5,925/year (2025/26): Kindergarten €5,925/yr (€592.50/month × 10); Classes 1–4 €5,925/yr (€592.50/month); Classes 5–8 €5,380/yr (€538/month); Classes 9–10 €5,875/yr (€587.50/month); Class 11 €5,925/yr (€592.50/month); Class 12 €5,925/yr (€658.33/month × 9). Matrícula (enrolment): €1,700 (1st child), €1,530 (2nd), €1,360 (3rd+). Fianza (refundable deposit): €1,000. Sibling discounts: 10% (2nd), 20% (3rd), 30% (4th+) — not applicable to Kindergarten. Additional: SpaF (Spanish as foreign language) €765–€985/yr; digital media fee Classes 5–8 €190/yr. Comedor (lunch) billed separately.
special_notes: One of the oldest international schools in Valencia, originally founded in 1909 with 4 German pupils. Closed during WWI (1914), Spanish Civil War (1936), and post-WWII (1945); secretly resumed in private homes in 1946. Current heritage-listed Modernist building (by Dieter Weisse, Peter Müller, Pablo Navarro & Julio Trullenque) inaugurated 1961 on C/ Jaume Roig. 14,000m² campus occupying a full city block near the University of Valencia. Andreu Alfaro fountain sculpture in central courtyard; garden designed by Rubió i Tudurí. Part of the ZfA (Zentralstelle für das Auslandsschulwesen) network of German schools abroad. ~50–60 students graduate with Abitur annually. Strong alumni network. Exchange programmes with Germany (Hamburg) and France. Music school and sports association on site. Mediterranean-based lunch menu with local products. Occasional scholarships available (at discretion of scholarship commission). Certified 'Exzellente Deutsche Auslandsschule'. Central location walkable/bikeable for most students.

name: American School of Valencia (ASV)
address: Avenida Sierra Calderona, 29, Urbanización Los Monasterios, 46530 Puçol, Valencia, Spain
neighborhood: Los Monasterios (gated residential estate, foothills of Sierra Calderona)
stages: Nursery (age 2), Pre-Kindergarten (PK3–PK4), Elementary School (Kindergarten–Grade 6), Middle School (Grades 7–8), High School (Grades 9–12). Three diploma pathways in Grades 11–12: American High School Diploma, Spanish Título de Bachillerato (via convalidation), and optionally the IB Diploma.
curriculum: American curriculum (US Common Core Standards) + Spanish National Standards + IB Diploma Programme (Grades 11–12, authorised since 2004). College-preparatory focus. 70+ course subjects in High School. MSA-CESS accredited (Middle States Association; current cycle through May 2027). Registered as Centro Extranjero with Spanish Ministry of Education (Code: 46016610).
languages_day_to_day: English is the primary language of instruction; Spanish language programme integrated throughout all grades (minimum 1 hour daily); world languages from Grade 7
languages_taught: English, Spanish, French, German, Valencian, Chinese (Mandarin)
device_policy_summary: Technology integrated throughout curriculum. Specific 1:1 device programme details not publicly confirmed — contact school to verify current grade-by-grade Chromebook/device rollout policy. Elementary uses workshop model with integrated technology for collaboration and creativity.
pedagogy: Inquiry-based learning; IB philosophy (critical thinking, global citizenship, international-mindedness); American college-preparatory approach; PBIS (Positive Behavioral Intervention and Supports) in Elementary; workshop model (Teachers College, Columbia University) for literacy; student agency and collaboration emphasised. World Language Acquisition aligned with CEFR and ACTFL standards. Model United Nations programme and global student exchanges.
fees_range: €7,246–€9,545/year (2025/26, per International Schools Database). Breakdown by stage: Nursery ~€7,246; Elementary ~€6,047–€7,200; Middle School ~€7,500–€8,000; High School (Gr 9–12) ~€7,790–€9,545. First-year total ~€12,571 incl. one-time fees. Capital fee: €1,500 (refundable share). Enrolment fee: €1,200. Bus: ~€1,620/year. Books: €316–€477 depending on grade. Sibling discounts may apply — contact admissions. Lunch billed separately.
student_count: ~700–800 students (estimated; Glassdoor lists 51–200 employees; majority of students enter at age 2–3 and stay through graduation at 18). Not officially published — contact school for exact figure.
special_notes: One of the oldest international schools in Valencia (founded 1980 with MSA support). 45th anniversary celebrated in 2025. Located in Puçol's Los Monasterios gated estate, ~20–25km north of Valencia city centre (~30 min drive), in the foothills of the Sierra Calderona mountains. 32,000m² campus with three parks, artificial turf playing field, and swimming pool. MSA-CESS accredited since founding (current accreditation through May 2027; next cycle underway toward 2027). IB Diploma Programme since 2004 — one of the first two schools to implement IB in Valencia. IB results consistently above world average. Graduates earn up to 3 diplomas (American, Spanish Bachillerato, IB). Strong university placement record (top-tier Spanish and international universities). Member of MAIS (Mediterranean Association of International Schools), ASCD, and ECIS. Director: Michael L. Smith. ASV+ co-curricular programme (sports teams, STEM, arts). AENOR sustainability certification for lunch service. Bus routes from Valencia, Rocafort, Godella, La Cañada, Sagunto. Summer programmes available (STEAM Camp, Discover America, Level Up Your English). Eco-School project active. Rolling admissions year-round.

name: Caxton College
address: Carrer Mas de León 5, 46530 Puçol, Valencia, Spain
neighborhood: Near Puçol town centre; north of railway station, surrounded by orange groves, ~3km from Mediterranean coast
stages: Baby Caxton (ages 1–2), Nursery (age 3), Reception (age 4), Primary (Years 1–6, ages 5–11), Secondary (Years 7–11, ages 11–16, iGCSE), Sixth Form (Years 12–13, ages 16–18, A-Levels). Uniform compulsory through Year 11; Sixth Form follows a dress code.
curriculum: British National Curriculum throughout all stages. iGCSE (Year 10–11) and A-Levels (Year 12–13) via Edexcel and AQA exam boards. Spanish compulsory curriculum subjects (Lengua, Valenciano, Ciencias Sociales, Religión) integrated to allow dual qualification: A-Levels + Spanish ESO/Bachillerato (via convalidation) + Spanish PCE (Pruebas de Competencia Específica) for Spanish university access. BSO (British Schools Overseas) accredited with 'Excellent' rating in ALL areas — first awarded 2017 by Cambridge Education, renewed 2019 by ISI (Independent Schools Inspectorate), and 2022. Listed by UK DfE as a school of reference outside Britain. Member of NABSS and ACADE.
languages_day_to_day: English is the primary language of instruction (80% of teaching staff are British); Spanish and Valencian for compulsory Spanish curriculum subjects taught by Spanish staff
languages_taught: English, Spanish, Valencian, French, German, Chinese (Mandarin)
device_policy_summary: IT/computing taught from Year 1 to Year 11 following British model (computational thinking, programming, robotics). ICT suites and robotics classroom on campus. Specific BYOD/1:1 device policy details not publicly confirmed — the school implemented a 'new technology approach' in consultation with families and educational specialists to promote productive use while minimising risks. Contact school for current grade-by-grade device policy.
pedagogy: British education model with emphasis on values (motto: 'Honeste Vivere' — Live Honourably), creativity, inquiry, autonomy, and critical thinking. Pastoral care system with dedicated co-head of academics and co-head of pastoral in secondary (restructured from single head role). PBIS-style positive behaviour framework. Classmate-mentor system for new students. Experienced SENCos in both primary and secondary; psychologist and speech therapist in primary. Strong emphasis on emotional wellbeing, values education (respect, resilience, responsibility), and personal development.
coords_confidence: verified_isbi (39.6337, -0.3062; cross-checked with Micole and NABSS listings)
fees_range: €7,780–€9,860/year (2025/26, per International Schools Database). First-year total ~€7,956 for age 1 (incl. one-time fees). Fees payable monthly. Exam fees charged additionally for Years 11, 12, and 13. School bus available (20+ routes covering Valencia and Castellón province). Lunch (comedor) with onsite kitchens — billed separately. Exact stage-by-stage breakdown: contact school or visit caxtoncollege.com/en/admissions/fees. Note: ISD range €7,780–€9,860 is significantly higher than original estimate of €600–700/month.
student_count: ~1,200+ students (estimated from: Good Schools Guide notes Reception regularly full with waiting lists; 109 pupils in most recent Sixth Form cohort alone; 66% Spanish + 20% international from 45+ nationalities; campus is 42,000–45,000m²). Not officially published — contact school for exact figure.
special_notes: One of the most highly regarded British schools in the Valencia region. Founded 1987 by the Gil-Marqués family; current principal: Marta Gil Marqués (since August 2023, youngest of five sisters; succeeded Amparo Gil). Motto: 'Honeste Vivere' (Live Honourably). 42,000m² (some sources cite 45,000m²) purpose-built campus surrounded by orange groves, ~18km north of Valencia city, ~3km from Mediterranean. Exceptional facilities: 9 science labs; William Caxton Library (35,000+ publications, full-time librarians); theatre (330 seats, sound/lighting booth); Caxton Sports Centre with fitness rooms; 2 gymnasiums; outdoor + heated indoor 25m swimming pools; 2 eight-a-side astroturf football pitches; sports pavilion with regulation basketball court (opened December 2024, professional-grade, homologated to Liga ACB standards); outdoor basketball court; 2 tennis courts; padel court; 6 outdoor learning areas in Early Years/Primary; 5 playground areas; specialist art/music classrooms in secondary; Caxton Young Artists Gallery; 4 dining rooms (age-differentiated) with onsite kitchens; clinic with full-time nurse + nursing assistant. School transport: 20+ bus routes covering Valencia, Sagunto, Castellón. Academic results: >85% achieve A*–C in A-Levels; 2024/25 average Sixth Form grade 8.6/10; average Spanish university admission grade 12.3. Pearson Outstanding Learner Awards recipients. ~75% of graduates attend Spanish universities (most popular: IE, Universitat de València); ~25% attend universities abroad — alumni at Oxford, Cambridge, Imperial College, Harvard, Columbia, Dartmouth, MIT, Berkeley, LSE, UCL, King's College London. 2024 cohort: 1 student to Oxford; others to Imperial (Aerospace Engineering, Chemical Engineering), King's College London (Economics), UCL (Biochemistry). 66% Spanish student body; ~20% international from 45+ nationalities. Boarding available via host families (international students). Club Deportivo for competitive-level sport. Summer English/sports camps (tennis, football). BSO 'Excellent' in all areas since 2017 (three consecutive inspections). ISI and Cambridge Education accredited. Good Schools Guide reviewed.

name: British School of Valencia (BSV)
address: Main Campus: C/ Filipinas, 37, 46006 València (also fronting Av. Peris i Valero, 57); BSV Nexus (Sixth Form): Av. Peris y Valero, 99, 46006 València
neighborhood: Ruzafa (city centre). Both campuses within ~5 minutes' walk of each other. Only British school IN Valencia city centre.
stages: Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS): Pre-Nursery (age 2–3), Nursery (age 3–4), Reception (age 4–5). Primary (Years 1–6, ages 5–11). Secondary (Years 7–11, ages 11–16, Cambridge IGCSE). Sixth Form at BSV Nexus (Years 12–13, ages 16–18, AS/A-Levels). Dual qualification: A-Levels + Spanish Bachillerato.
curriculum: British National Curriculum (EYFS through A-Levels). Cambridge Assessment International Education (Cambridge IGCSE, AS & A-Level examinations). Also uses Oxford AQA and Pearson Edexcel exam boards. Spanish compulsory curriculum subjects (Lengua, Valenciano, Ciencias Sociales) integrated for ESO/Bachillerato dual qualification. Cambridge Checkpoint intermediate exams (end of Year 9). Recognised by both UK and Spanish educational authorities. Member of NABSS (National Association of British Schools in Spain). Common Sense School (digital citizenship). European Youth Parliament participant.
languages_day_to_day: English is the primary language of instruction; Spanish for required Spanish curriculum subjects (Lengua, Valenciano, Ciencias Sociales)
languages_taught: English, Spanish, Valencian, French, German, Chinese (Mandarin). Language accreditation programme enables students to obtain official certifications in multiple languages through external examinations.
device_policy_summary: 1:1 Digital Learning Programme: each student has their own digital device (tablets/laptops). All classrooms equipped with interactive touchscreens regardless of year group. Movable wall classrooms for flexible/collaborative learning. Common Sense School certified for digital citizenship and online safety. BSV has a dedicated Digital Learning Programme and Digital Leaders programme among students. Exact grade of introduction and device model — contact school to confirm current year-by-year rollout.
pedagogy: British curriculum approach with emphasis on core values: respect, tolerance, creativity, initiative, personal effort. Character development programme. Wellbeing Programme. University & Career Guidance Programme. Academic Excellence Awards (50% fee reduction scholarship for outstanding Year 11 and Year 12 students). Outstanding Cambridge Learner Awards recipients since 2008/09 (including Top in the World, Top in Spain, and High Achievement awards). Music Programme with soundproofed practice cabins and individual instrument tuition. Duke of Edinburgh Award scheme participant. European Youth Parliament. Extra-curricular activities programme.
coords_confidence: approximate_ruzafa (C/ Filipinas 37, Ruzafa neighbourhood, central Valencia)
fees_range: OFFICIAL FEES 2025/26 (from bsvalencia.com, paid in 10 monthly instalments): EYFS (Pre-Nursery/Nursery/Reception): €715/month = €7,150/year. Primary (Years 1–6): €790/month = €7,900/year. Secondary (Years 7–11): €920/month = €9,200/year. Sixth Form (Years 12–13): €957/month = €9,570/year. Admission fee: €3,250 (first-time enrolment; €1,600 for siblings and Year 7–13 entries). Annual renewal: €445 (non-refundable). School materials: €242/term (€726/year). Transport: €199/month (optional). Dining room: €210/month (mandatory Pre-Nursery to Year 3). Morning Club: €25–€50/month. Afternoon Homework Club: €25–€50/month. School of Music: €790/year (33 classes). Textbooks invoiced separately in November. Uniform from El Corte Inglés.
student_count: Not officially published. Estimated ~600–800+ students (70+ nationalities represented; two campuses; BSV Nexus 1,800m² for Sixth Form). Contact school for exact figure.
special_notes: ONLY British school in Valencia city centre (Ruzafa neighbourhood — walkable, public transport accessible). Founded 1992; part of Cognita Schools Group since January 2019 (Cognita operates 100+ schools worldwide incl. 7 in Spain). Two campuses ~5 min walk apart in Ruzafa: Main campus (C/ Filipinas 37) occupies nearly a full city block — EYFS, Primary, Secondary; BSV Nexus (Av. Peris y Valero 99) — 1,800m² purpose-built Sixth Form pre-university centre with 4 permanent classrooms, 4 flexible support rooms (movable walls), 2 labs, library, art room, cafeteria, multifunctional study space, 2 teacher rooms; BREEAM sustainability certification; abundant natural light, wood finishes, and greenery. Significant recent investment to expand/renovate both campuses. All classrooms equipped with interactive touchscreens. Outstanding Cambridge Learner Awards since 2008/09: Top in the World (AS PE; A-Level Spanish Lang & Lit), Top in Spain, High Achievement (AS French) — across IGCSE, AS, and A-Level subjects. Academic Excellence Awards: 50% fee reduction scholarships for top Year 11/12 students. Rankings: El Mundo top 12 international schools in Comunidad Valenciana; Forbes Best Schools in Spain; El Confidencial/Micole 3rd most requested private school in Spain; Micole top 100 Best Private Schools in Spain, top 25 in Valencia city, top 100 in Valencia region (2026). 70+ nationalities represented. Main limitation: limited outdoor/sports space due to city-centre location (noted by alumni reviews). Bus service available (optional, €199/month). Rolling admissions year-round; non-selective but requires academic records and interview. Summer school available. School of Music with soundproofed cabins. Duke of Edinburgh Award. European Youth Parliament.

name: English School Los Olivos
address: Primary: C/ Pino Panera, 25, 46110 Godella (Valencia); Secondary: Av. de los Almendros, 13, 46110 Godella (Valencia). NOTE: Original address 'C/ de la Muntanyeta, 1' is INCORRECT — not associated with this school.
neighborhood: Campolivar / Campo Olivar (peaceful, tree-lined residential area in Godella, ~15–20 min drive NW of Valencia city centre)
ages: 3 to 18 years (CORRECTED from original '2 to 18' — school starts at age 3 per all official sources)
stages: Foundation Stage / Nursery (age 3–5), Primary (Years 1–6, ages 5–11), Secondary (Years 7–11, ages 11–16, IGCSE/GCSE), Sixth Form (Years 12–13, ages 16–18, AS & A-Levels). Dual qualification: A-Levels + Spanish Bachillerato (via convalidation).
curriculum: Full British National Curriculum (UK) from Foundation to A-Levels. Accredited Cambridge and Edexcel examination centre. Cambridge IGCSE (Year 10–11) and AS/A-Level (Year 12–13). Spanish compulsory subjects (Lengua y Literatura Española, Ciencias Sociales, Valenciano) integrated for dual qualification. Member of NABSS (National Association of British Schools in Spain). Authorised by Spanish Ministry of Education as Centro Extranjero — qualifications recognised in both UK and Spain.
languages_day_to_day: English is the primary language of instruction (native English-speaking teachers for all British curriculum subjects); Spanish for required Spanish curriculum subjects
languages_taught: English, Spanish, Valencian. NOTE: Original entry claimed German as a prominent language — this is NOT confirmed by any official source (school website, NABSS profile, Micole, ISD, MumAbroad, iSchoolAdvisor). German is NOT listed as a taught language. This appears to be an error in the original data.
device_policy_summary: No public grade-by-grade device rollout policy found. School has IT rooms on both campuses. Contact school for current technology/device policy details.
pedagogy: British educational approach run as a teacher cooperative. Core values: respect, dialogue, tolerance, freedom, responsibility, teamwork, participation, critical thinking. Secular and pluralist ethos. Historical roots in Montessori and Freinet pedagogy (1976 founding), combined with Piaget's developmental psychology principles. Focus on individual development across human, emotional, intellectual, artistic, and physical dimensions. Strong community and family-oriented atmosphere with personal attention. Small school ethos (~570 pupils). Every child known by name.
coords_confidence: verified_isbi (39.5356, -0.4247; ISBI Schools). CORRECTED from original 39.5397/-0.4062 which was approximate. Note: coordinates point to Campolivar/Godella area.
micole_rating: 4.4 (Primary campus, 30 reviews); 4.2 (Secondary campus, 32 reviews) — listed as separate entries on Micole
google_rating: 4.5 (approximate, based on iSchoolAdvisor Google reviews aggregate)
fees_range: ~€7,150/year first-year total for age 3 (per ISD 2025/26, incl. one-time fees). Annual tuition not broken down publicly in detail — Micole lists 'more than €700/month'. 25% discount on tuition for third child. Pre-enrolment is free. Contact school for full fee schedule. Dining room with freshly prepared meals from own kitchens (fee not publicly listed). Bus routes to/from Valencia city available.
student_count: ~570 students (per NABSS profile: 'around 570 pupils, combining local families and international students')
special_notes: One of the oldest British schools in Valencia, founded in 1976 as a British nursery in El Plantío-La Cañada in a traditional Valencian farmstead surrounded by olive trees (hence the name 'Los Olivos'). Originally followed Montessori and Freinet methodology. Run as a TEACHER COOPERATIVE (unusual structure — not a family/corporate-owned school) of highly qualified British and Spanish teachers, secular and apolitical. Two purpose-built campuses in Campolivar/Godella: Primary (C/ Pino Panera 25, built 1983, expanded with secondary wing) and Secondary (Av. de los Almendros 13, built 1996–97, first GCSE cohort June 1998). Facilities: science labs, IT rooms, music and art rooms, sports areas, dining halls with own kitchens preparing fresh meals. Extracurricular: guitar, piano, yoga, chess, robotics, dance, art, roller skating, football, basketball, tennis, rhythmic gymnastics, volleyball. OUTSTANDING ACADEMIC RESULTS (2025 session): 100% A-Level pass rate; 73% of A-Level students achieving A or A*; 96% of IGCSE students achieving 5+ A*-C/9-4 passes; 100% pass Spanish university entrance; average Spanish university entrance grade 12.08/14. Small, family-oriented school — strong community spirit emphasised by parents and alumni. Recognised as one of 19 best schools in Spain (per iSchoolAdvisor review). ~15–20 min drive NW from Valencia centre. Bus routes available.

name: Centro Educativo Gençana
type: Private (1st cycle Infantil, ages 1–2) / Concertado (2nd cycle Infantil through Bachillerato — concierto singular for Bachillerato)
address: C/ Ermita Nova, 3, 46110 Godella, Valencia, Spain (single campus)
neighborhood: Quiet residential area of Godella, close to Valencia city with excellent road connections. Multipurpose building integrated into the residential architecture, surrounded by green areas, with classrooms bordered by trees and gardens.
stages: 1st Cycle Educación Infantil (ages 1–2, private). 2nd Cycle Educación Infantil (ages 3–5, concertado). Educación Primaria (ages 6–11, concertado). ESO - Educación Secundaria Obligatoria (ages 12–15, concertado). Bachillerato: Científico-Técnico and Humanidades y Ciencias Sociales (ages 16–18, concierto singular).
curriculum: Spanish national curriculum (LOMLOE). Experimental, project-based learning methodology — 'Hacer es comprender' ('Doing is Understanding'). Five differentiated levels of programming per class based on student maturity, set by the Gabinete Psicopedagógico and reviewed termly. Plans include: Plan de Convivencia, Plan de Acción Tutorial, Plan de Fomento a la Lectura, Proyecto Lingüístico del Centro, Plan de Transición between stages. University professors collaborate with departments. Student research projects (trabajos de investigación) are a core element. Robotics and Oratoria (public speaking) programmes integrated.
languages_day_to_day: Plurilingual programme: Spanish, Valencian, English, French. English is prioritised and integrated into several non-language subjects (Expresión Corporal, Educación Física, Ciencias Naturales, Biología, Economía). Students prepared for Cambridge English certifications (B1, B2, C1 achieved by secondary/Bachillerato students). 6 English conversation assistants in Primary alone.
languages_taught: Spanish, Valencian, English, French. Introduction to Chinese language and culture in ESO (confirmed by Ajuntament de Godella official page).
device_policy_summary: Digital learning platform Alexia used by teachers, parents, and students. Students from 4º Primaria (age 9–10) access an online collaborative learning environment complementary to classroom guides, with content libraries and collaborative materials shared by teachers. Online training and simulation programmes available. Press reports reference Chromebook 1:1 from 3º Primaria through Bachillerato — contact school to verify current device policy details.
pedagogy: Experiential, project-based learning rooted in the motto 'Hacer es comprender' (Doing is Understanding). School as a place of 'work and research.' Formation of individuals with critical capacity and ability to intervene positively in society. Five differentiated levels per class for individualised attention. Strong emphasis on: observation, experimentation, discovery; critical thinking and communication (oratoria programme); arts integration (Expresión Corporal, Danza, Bellas Artes, Music); scientific research projects. Comprehensive Gabinete Psicopedagógico providing: psychopedagogical evaluation of all students throughout schooling; individual tracking; school and career orientation; tutorial action plan; special needs support (both reinforcement and gifted programmes). Secular, co-educational institution.
coords_confidence: approximate_godella (from original data; consistent with C/ Ermita Nova, 3 location)
fees_range: COMPLEX FEE STRUCTURE: Concertado stages (2nd cycle Infantil through Bachillerato): base tuition covered by government subsidy. Micole classifies as 'Gratis or <€100/month.' HOWEVER, a 2023 Garlic B2B study identified Gençana as the MOST EXPENSIVE concertado in Comunitat Valenciana with a BASE CUOTA of €450/month (which includes comedor and school materials). El Mundo ranking listed: €273.15/month for 1st cycle Infantil (private) and €25.70/month for Bachillerato (concierto singular). 1st Cycle Infantil (private): separate private fee. Dining room: own kitchen, breakfast/lunch/snack; adapted menus (coeliac, diabetic, vegetarian, vegan, macrobiotic). Annual renewal fee €445 (referenced in El Mundo data). The real cost is significantly higher than 'free' — families should request full fee breakdown directly from the school. Extended hours available 7:30–18:30.
student_count: ~452 students (your original figure; consistent with school being described as having '80 personas' on staff and small cohort sizes — e.g. 17 students in 2º Bachillerato 2014/15). Website's 'De un vistazo' page lists statistics dynamically. Primary alone has 25 teachers/assistants for ~6 year groups.
special_notes: Highly regarded innovative school in Godella, founded 1981. Consistently ranked among BEST SCHOOLS in Spain: El Mundo 100 Mejores Colegios de España (82/100 points); PAU/Selectividad 2023: 2nd highest average in entire Comunitat Valenciana (7.94/10), behind only San Alberto Magno, Alicante (8.39). Strong critical thinking, research, and communication focus — students regularly win national/regional academic competitions: Physics Olympiad (best score in Comunitat Valenciana), Chemistry Olympiad, Cangur Mathematics prizes, Trau la Llengua literary prizes, Experimenta STEM fair awards, Concurso de Fotografía Matemática. Conselleria de Educación designation as CEPAFE (Centro Educativo Promotor de la Actividad Física y el Deporte). Cambridge English certifications through C1 level. Facilities: single campus with specialised classrooms, gymnasium, library, movement expression and music rooms, green outdoor areas with trees and gardens. Primary hours: 8:45–16:30 (Sept–June, including 4 days of Easter). Extended hours: 7:30–18:30 for families needing flexibility. Summer School (July) open to external students. Gabinete Psicopedagógico with dedicated team of psychopedagogues + PT specialist + speech therapist. University entrance prep courses offered. Collaboration with university professors across departments. CAVEATS: Some families report high academic workload may not suit all learning styles. Some negative reviews on Buscocolegio cite rigid rules, high pressure, and cliquish culture. Polarising: long-term families (20+ years) are deeply loyal; others find the environment too demanding. Most EXPENSIVE concertado in CV per 2023 Garlic B2B study (€450/month base including comedor + materials). Digital platform Alexia for parent-teacher communication and student grades tracking.

name: CEIP Municipal Benimaclet (Colegio Público Municipal de Benimaclet)
type: Public — MUNICIPAL (run by Ajuntament de València, not Conselleria de Educación — one of only 3 municipal primary schools in Valencia city, alongside CEIP Prof. Santiago Grisolía and CEIP Fernando de los Ríos)
address: C/ de l'Arquitecte Arnau, s/n, 46020 València, Valencia, Spain
neighborhood: Benimaclet (historically Valencian-speaking barrio, NE of Valencia centre; vibrant, multicultural, socially active neighbourhood near Universitat Politècnica campus de Vera)
founded: Unknown exact founding year — described as 'el más antiguo de Benimaclet' (the oldest school in Benimaclet). Founded by the Ayuntamiento de València to address the lack of schools in the area. Historical roots go back decades.
ages: 3 to 12 years (2nd cycle Infantil + Primaria only — NO secondary. Adscribed IES: IES Rascanya for secondary continuation)
stages: 2nd Cycle Educación Infantil (ages 3–5, 3 year groups). Educación Primaria (ages 6–12, Years 1–6). NOTE: Does NOT offer 1st cycle Infantil (0–2). No secondary — students transfer to IES Rascanya.
curriculum: Spanish national curriculum (Valencian Community / LOMLOE). Plurilingual programme: PIP (Programa d'Incorporació Progressiva / Programa de Incorporación Progresiva). Project-based learning that motivates students through their own curiosity. Cooperative and active learning prioritised. New technologies used as complement to teaching-learning process. Erasmus+ project 'Change your Mind' (international school exchanges). Municipally funded inclusive education programmes: innovation technology for special needs, occupational therapy, augmentative communication for 0–6 year olds (in collaboration with FEVADIS and Colegio de Terapeutas Ocupacionales de la CV).
languages_day_to_day: Plurilingual: Spanish/Valencian vehicular languages (PIP programme — progressive incorporation of Valencian); English as foreign language
device_policy_summary: New technologies used as complement to teaching-learning process (school policy statement). IT classroom (Aula de Informática) available. No published 1:1 device programme — technology is integrated as a tool, not as primary medium. Contact school for current device policy specifics.
pedagogy: Inclusive, multicultural, community-embedded public school. Motto/values: critical, independent, inclusive, flexible — 'alumnado feliz' (happy students). Project-based learning driven by student curiosity. Strong emphasis on cooperative and active learning. Distinctive programmes: TUTORÍAS AFECTIVAS — affective tutoring programme to improve social-emotional skills, reduce behavioural issues (permanent resource, the school's pride); RINCÓN VIOLETA and BANCO DE LA AMISTAD — equality and coexistence initiatives; HUERTO ESCOLAR (school garden) — four plots integrated into the curriculum from age 3 to 6º Primaria, teaching ecology, planting, weeding, watering, harvesting. Open to the neighbourhood. AFA (family association) very active in organising extracurricular activities, support programmes, and summer school (July).
coords_confidence: approximate_benimaclet (consistent with C/ Arquitecte Arnau in Benimaclet neighbourhood)
google_rating: 4.1 (approximate — limited Google reviews for public primary schools)
google_reviews: ~30–50 (estimated; public CEIPs typically have few Google reviews)
fees_range: FREE (public municipal school). No tuition fees. Dining room: 220 places, own kitchen (cocina propia) — fee set by Ayuntamiento, typically ~€4–5/day for municipal schools. Escola Matinera (early morning care before school hours) and Escola Vespertina (afternoon care) available — fees set by municipal services. Summer school organised by AFA during July. Ayuntamiento doubles school meal grants (becas de comedor) per recent policy. €2.4M annual municipal budget for maintenance of all 3 municipal primary schools.
student_count: ~450 students (capacity: 150 Infantil places + 300 Primaria places, per Ayuntamiento de València official data from open day announcement). Highly diverse: ~27% foreign students in Infantil, ~41% foreign students in Primaria (per PEC document). Many Spanish students also from other autonomous communities or families without Valencian.
special_notes: Oldest school in Benimaclet, founded by Ayuntamiento de València. MUNICIPAL school — one of only THREE municipal CEIPs in Valencia city (rare status; most public schools are managed by Conselleria/Generalitat, not the city). U-shaped building, 2 floors. Very well-regarded by parents: Micole 4.6/5 (highest-rated public CEIP in database for Valencia). DISTINCTIVE FEATURES: Huerto Escolar (school garden) with 4 plots, integrated into curriculum from Infantil to 6º Primaria — all groups rotate through growing seasons; Tutorías Afectivas (affective mentoring — permanent emotional support programme); Rincón Violeta + Banco de la Amistad (equality and friendship initiatives); Erasmus+ 'Change your Mind' international project. Gabinete Psicopedagógico with orientation services, speech therapist (maestra de audición y lenguaje), and social worker (educación compensatoria). Inclusive education programmes funded by Ayuntamiento: technology innovation for early detection of special needs, occupational therapy in schools, augmentative communication for ages 0–6. Very active AFA (family association) organising extracurricular activities within the school. School hours: Mon–Thu 9:00–12:30 and 15:00–16:30; Fri 9:00–14:00; Sept/June 9:00–13:00. Library, music room, multipurpose hall, sports facilities. Adscribed IES for secondary: IES Rascanya. LIMITATIONS: Only goes to 6º Primaria (age 12) — families must transition to a public IES for secondary; limited Google/Micole review base (only 10 Micole reviews) despite high rating; being a public municipal school means staffing subject to municipal budget/politics. Located in popular Benimaclet neighbourhood — walkable, metro-connected, near UPV campus.

name: CEIP Francisco Giner de los Ríos
type: Public (Generalitat Valenciana / Conselleria de Educación, Cultura y Universidades)
address: Plaça Grup Parpalló, s/n (formerly Plaza Profesor López Ibor), 46015 València, Valencia, Spain. NOTE: Original address 'C/ de Ruaya, 28, 46009' is INCORRECT — not associated with this school. The school is in Campanar, not near C/ Ruaya. Verified across GVA portal, Micole, Todoeduca, Buscocolegio, Infociudad.
neighborhood: Campanar (historically Valencian-speaking former village, now integrated into NW Valencia; near Hospital 9 d'Octubre). School's own tagline: 'Tu cole en Campanar'.
ages: 3 to 12 years (2nd cycle Infantil + Primaria only — no secondary)
stages: 2nd Cycle Educación Infantil (ages 3–5). Educación Primaria (ages 6–12, Years 1–6). No secondary — students transferred to IES Campanar (from 1999/2000 when ESO was removed from the school).
curriculum: Spanish national curriculum (Valencian Community / LOMLOE). Linguistic programme: PEPLI (Programa Educativo Plurilingüe en Lengua de Inmersión). Two historical linguistic lines: PIP (Programa d'Incorporació Progressiva) and PIL (Programa d'Immersió Lingüística), now unified under PEPLI. PIIE (Proyecto de Innovación e Investigación Educativa) — innovation research project with two convocatorias: 2023–2025 and 2025–2027. Erasmus+ international projects: 'Change your lifestyle' and Erasmus+ STEM. Proyecto 50-50 (energy efficiency/sustainability project). Píldoras Lectoras (reading pills — literacy initiative). Banco de Libros (textbook exchange programme).
languages_day_to_day: Plurilingual (PEPLI): Valencian as immersion language; Spanish; English as foreign language. Historically a Valencian-speaking area — strong Valencian presence.
device_policy_summary: No published 1:1 device programme found. School has technology as complement to teaching. Contact school for current device policy details.
pedagogy: Named after Francisco Giner de los Ríos (1839–1915), the renowned Spanish pedagogue who founded the Institución Libre de Enseñanza — one of Spain's most important figures in progressive education, advocating for secularism, critical thinking, and experiential learning. School philosophy aligned with inclusive, quality, equitable education. Innovation and research focus through PIIE projects. Environmental sustainability through Proyecto 50-50. International dimension through Erasmus+ exchanges. Active AMPA (parents' association) organising extracurricular activities.
coords_confidence: NEEDS CORRECTION: Original coordinates 39.4869/-0.3803 appear to point near Marxalenes/Ruaya area, NOT Campanar/Plaça Grup Parpalló. Approximate correct coordinates for Plaça Grup Parpalló in Campanar: ~39.4785/-0.3940. Verify with GVA Guia de Centres.
google_rating: 4.8 (per Expirit.es directory, based on Google reviews)
google_reviews: ~20–30 (estimated; public CEIPs have limited Google review counts)
fees_range: FREE (public school). No tuition fees. Comedor escolar available (school canteen). Banco de Libros (textbook lending/exchange programme — reduces costs). Becas (grants) available. Contact school for comedor fees.
student_count: ~300–450 students (estimated from historical context: opened 1981 with 637 students; decreased after ESO transfer to IES Campanar in 1999/2000. Current capacity as a 2-line CEIP would be approximately 450: 6 Infantil groups + 12 Primaria groups × ~25 students).
special_notes: Public CEIP in the heart of Campanar (historically Valencian-speaking former village, NW Valencia). NOTE: YOUR ORIGINAL ADDRESS 'C/ de Ruaya, 28, 46009' IS WRONG — the correct address is Plaça Grup Parpalló, s/n, 46015 València (Campanar). Also, original coordinates need correction to ~39.4785/-0.3940. Founded 1981 as a spin-off from CP Campanar due to overcrowding (637 students at opening). U-shaped building completed summer 1981, opened September 1981. Some land ceded for Hospital 9 d'Octubre construction in exchange for expanded playground space on west side. In 1992 renamed from EGB to Educación Primaria. Valencian line established 1996. ESO removed 1996/97 (students transferred to IES Campanar from 1999/2000). 2nd cycle Infantil authorised 1997. DISTINCTIVE FEATURES: PIIE (Innovation & Educational Research Project) — awarded consecutive convocatorias 2023–2025 and 2025–2027; Erasmus+ 'Change your lifestyle' and Erasmus+ STEM international exchange programmes; Proyecto 50-50 (environmental/energy sustainability); Píldoras Lectoras (reading initiative); Banco de Libros (textbook exchange). PEPLI plurilingual programme with strong Valencian immersion. Active AMPA with extracurricular activities. Micole 4.0/5 (21 reviews) with positive parent feedback praising teaching quality, equipment, excursions, and comedor staff. Google 4.8/5 (high satisfaction). Named after Francisco Giner de los Ríos, founder of the Institución Libre de Enseñanza — Spain's most important progressive education reformer.

name: CEIP Rodríguez Fornos
type: Public (Generalitat Valenciana / Conselleria d'Educació, Cultura i Universitats)
address: Carrer de la Mare de Déu de la Cabeza, 26 (C/ Virgen de la Cabeza, 26), 46014 València, Valencia, Spain. NOTE: Original address 'C/ del Mestre Asensi, 3, 46020' is INCORRECT — not associated with this school. Verified across GVA portal (code 46012771), Micole, Todoeduca, Educateca, Buscocolegio, and Ayuntamiento de València press releases. The school is in Safranar (Patraix district), not in the 46020 postcode area.
neighborhood: Safranar, in the Patraix district (SW Valencia). Working-class residential neighbourhood. 86% Spanish nationality, 14% foreign — mostly from South America, then EU, Asia, Africa. Majority of families work in the commerce/services sector. Neighbourhoods in catchment area: Vara de Quart, Safranar, Favara, and Patraix.
founded: Pre-1970 (exact founding date not published on school website; a Micole reviewer recalls doing teacher training practice there in 1970–1971, confirming the school existed by at least the late 1960s. Named after Dr. Rodríguez Fornos — a Valencian doctor with a street named after him in the city.)
ages: 3 to 12 years (2nd cycle Infantil + Primaria only — no secondary)
stages: 2nd Cycle Educación Infantil (ages 3–5). Educación Primaria (ages 6–12, Years 1–6). No secondary — adscribed IES: IES Vicenta Ferrer Escrivá (Patraix), C/ La Vall d'Uixó, 2, 46014 València.
curriculum: Spanish national curriculum (Valencian Community / LOMLOE). Bilingual school (Spanish/English). School website entirely in Valencian, indicating strong Valencian language use. Concreció Curricular and PEC documents available on GVA portal. Active participation in GVA cultural/arts programmes: Escolarts ('L'Escola Canta' — cantata 'Els Súper ODS: Aventura 2030' performed jointly with CEIP Raquel Payá, accompanied by Agrupació Musical de Patraix); Escola Dansa (dance programme); Innov@dansa; Musiescola. Collaboration with Save the Children (dedicated section on school website). School radio programme (Ràdio). Dia de la Pau (Peace Day) projects. Dia de l'Esport (Sport Day). Banc de Llibres (textbook exchange programme). Projecte Educatiu Menjador (educational dining project — comedor as a pedagogical space, not just meal provision).
languages_day_to_day: Bilingual: Spanish and English. Valencian also used (school website/communications in Valencian). GVA portal shows linguistic programme in place.
device_policy_summary: Pizarras digitales (interactive whiteboards/digital boards). Aula de informática (IT room). No published 1:1 device programme. Contact school for current device policy.
pedagogy: Large, well-established public CEIP with strong community engagement. Named after Dr. Rodríguez Fornos (Valencian doctor). DISTINCTIVE FEATURES: Save the Children collaboration (dedicated section on website — suggests ongoing social responsibility/solidarity projects); School Radio (Ràdio — media/literacy programme); Projecte Educatiu Menjador (dining room as educational project — not just catering but pedagogical programme around nutrition/social skills); Escuela de Pilota Valenciana (one of 7 schools in Valencia offering traditional Valencian pelota — cultural heritage sport); Escolarts choral cantatas (SDGs-themed 'Els Súper ODS: Aventura 2030'); Escola Dansa and Innov@dansa dance programmes; Musiescola. Very active AFA (afarodriguezfornos.es — own website) organising extracurriculars (sports, cultural), Matinera (early morning care), and offering AFA membership for €30/year with local commerce discounts. Notable solidarity during 2024 DANA flooding: school welcomed affected children for weeks, praised by families for empathy and professionalism.

The original coordinates appear to correspond to a location NE of the city centre (near Benimaclet/Algirós area), which is inconsistent with Safranar/Patraix in the SW.
google_rating: ~4.0–4.5 (estimated from limited Google reviews; Buscocolegio shows mixed reviews but those are partly confused with the adscribed IES, not the CEIP itself)
google_reviews: ~30–50 (estimated; public CEIPs typically have limited Google review counts)
fees_range: FREE (public school). No tuition fees. Comedor escolar: ~80% of students use it (per school programming document); own kitchen not confirmed — likely catering service. Projecte Educatiu Menjador indicates a structured educational approach to dining. Becas/Ajudes menjador (dining grants) available. Banc de Llibres (textbook exchange). AFA membership: €30/year per family (enables access to AFA-organised extracurriculars at preferential rates; non-members pay €50/child for extracurricular access). Matinera (early morning care) available via AFA.
student_count: ~650 students (confirmed via school's own Programación Básica de Educación Infantil document: 'El centro tiene 650 alumnos/as entre las etapas de infantil y primaria'). This makes it a relatively large CEIP. ~80% of students use the school dining service.
special_notes: Public CEIP in Safranar barrio (Patraix district), SW Valencia. NOTE: YOUR ORIGINAL ADDRESS 'C/ del Mestre Asensi, 3, 46020' IS WRONG — the correct address is C/ Virgen de la Cabeza 26 (Carrer de la Mare de Déu de la Cabeza 26), 46014 València. Also, original coordinates (39.4793/-0.3594) point to Benimaclet/Algirós area — need correction to ~39.4620/-0.3880 for Safranar/Patraix. Named after Dr. Rodríguez Fornos (Valencian doctor, has a street named after him). Pre-dates 1970 (teacher training confirmed for 1970-71). LARGE school: 650 students, ~80% using comedor. School code: 46012771. Adscribed to IES Vicenta Ferrer Escrivá (Patraix). DISTINCTIVE FEATURES: Save the Children collaboration; School Radio (Ràdio); Escuela de Pilota Valenciana (1 of 7 in Valencia — traditional Valencian pelota); Escolarts cantatas (SDG-themed); Escola Dansa + Innov@dansa; Musiescola; Projecte Educatiu Menjador (pedagogical dining programme). Very active AFA with own website (afarodriguezfornos.es), organising extensive extracurriculars (sports + cultural, both private and municipal), Matinera service, and offering local commerce discounts for members. Plan Edificant improvements: €73,759 renovation completed (2020s); playground drainage replacement €23,626. Notable solidarity: school welcomed DANA-affected children for weeks in late 2024, receiving high praise. Facilities: spacious classrooms, 2 football pitches, basketball courts, IT room, music room, library, laboratory, interactive digital boards. Micole 4.6/5 (33 reviews) — very positive parent feedback praising teaching quality, caring staff, food quality, and community spirit. Among the best-rated public CEIPs in Valencia. Micole ranking badge: 'Entre los mejores Colegios de 2026'.

name: CEIP Jaime Balmes (Colegio Público Jaime Balmes / Grup Escolar Balmes)
type: Public (Generalitat Valenciana / Conselleria de Educación, Cultura y Universidades). Building owned by Conselleria de Cultura. Classified as Bien Inmueble de Etnología (ethnological heritage asset).
address: C/ Maestro Aguilar, 15 (entrance also from C/ Pintor Salvador Abril, 40), 46006 València, Valencia, Spain. NOTE: Original address 'C/ de Quart, 55, 46001' is INCORRECT — not associated with this school. C/ de Quart is in the Ciutat Vella/Botanico area, while this school is in Ruzafa (L'Eixample district). Verified across Wikipedia, GVA (code 46012197), Micole, Todoeduca, Buscocolegio, Educateca, Páginas Amarillas, Planea, AMPA website, and school's own WordPress/blogspot.
neighborhood: Ruzafa / Russafa (L'Eixample district). One of Valencia's most vibrant, multicultural, gentrifying neighbourhoods south of the city centre. Historically a separate village (annexed 1877), now a trendy area known for its cafés, galleries, and diverse international community. The school describes Ruzafa as 'un barrio singular — un lugar multicultural que nos enriquece a todos por su pluralidad de valores'.
founded: 1911 (architectural project by D. Eugenio López); operational from 1915. Named 'Jaime Balmes' in 1913 by Comisión de Instrucción Pública (replacing originally planned name 'Menéndez y Pelayo' — 'a name that will allow children to pronounce it more briefly'). Escuela graduada since 1 September 1919. BUT the site has educational roots going back to the late 18th century — a school existed here before 1841, when maestro Francisco Javier Aguilar Solaz was already running it. The street is named after this teacher who died heroically on 2 June 1863 saving his students when the school building collapsed.
ages: 3 to 12 years (2nd cycle Infantil + Primaria only — no secondary)
stages: 2nd Cycle Educación Infantil (ages 3–5, 2 lines). Educación Primaria (ages 6–12, Years 1–6, 2 lines). Two-line school (2 groups per year). No secondary.
curriculum: Spanish national curriculum (Valencian Community / LOMLOE). Two linguistic programmes: PIL (Programa d'Immersió Lingüística — Valencian immersion) and PIP (Programa d'Incorporació Progressiva — progressive incorporation). PIIE (Proyecto de Innovación e Investigación Educativa, conv. 2024). Member of RED PLANEA — national network connecting contemporary art, education and young people (run by Fundación Daniel y Nina Carasso with FECYT and Ministry of Culture). CEPAFD (Centro de Educación Promotor de la Actividad Física y el Deporte). Escolarts: L'Escola Dansa (dance programme). Biblioteca programme with special events (e.g. Halloween en la Biblioteca). Día de la Paz activities.
languages_day_to_day: Bilingual: Spanish and Valencian (two linguistic lines: PIL immersion + PIP progressive). English as foreign language.
device_policy_summary: No published 1:1 device programme found. School's Planea profile mentions being 'at the vanguard of educational resources'. Contact school for current device policy.
pedagogy: HERITAGE BUILDING from 1911 in Valencian modernismo tardío (late Art Nouveau) style. Two symmetrical blocks connected by a central courtyard/playground. Original floral ornamentation preserved on first floor of both façades. Original inscribed rótulo 'Escuelas Nacionales Graduadas Grupo Balmes' still visible, crowned by Valencia city coat of arms. Roof structures similar to the famous Mercado de Colón. Profoundly rehabilitated in early 2000s (Conselleria de Cultura), discovering a SPANISH CIVIL WAR AIR-RAID SHELTER (refugio antiaéreo) in the school courtyard — now visitable and in excellent conservation. The school's Planea profile self-describes as: 'una escuela inquieta, inclusiva e innovadora — una escuela singular, una escuela especial, una gran escuela pública'. Active AMPA with own website (colegiobalmes.wixsite.com/ampa). Named after Jaume Balmes (1810–1848), Catalan philosopher and Catholic apologist. NOTABLE ALUMNI: Francisco Tomás y Valiente (eminent jurist, president of Spain's Constitutional Court 1980–1992, assassinated by ETA in 1996); Julián San Valero Aparisi (archaeologist/researcher). First director: Francisco Monterde. First girls' school director: Pilar Ochoa.
coords_confidence: NEEDS CORRECTION: Original coordinates 39.4693/-0.3864 are approximate and described as 'approximate_city_center'. The school is at C/ Maestro Aguilar 15 in Ruzafa, which is approximately at 39.4633/-0.3745. The original coordinates point slightly NW (near Torres de Quart), not to Ruzafa.
google_rating: ~4.2 (estimated from Google Maps presence; school has dedicated Wikipedia article suggesting cultural significance)
fees_range: FREE (public school). No tuition fees. Comedor escolar available (menus shared via SharePoint). Contact school for comedor fees. Becas available.
student_count: ~250–450 students (estimated: 2-line school × 9 year groups × ~25 students = ~450 max capacity. AMPA interview mentions need for more places, suggesting school is near capacity. No exact figure published.)
special_notes: Public CEIP in the heart of Ruzafa (L'Eixample district), one of Valencia's most vibrant and multicultural neighbourhoods. NOTE: YOUR ORIGINAL ADDRESS 'C/ de Quart, 55, 46001' IS WRONG — the correct address is C/ Maestro Aguilar 15 (+ C/ Pintor Salvador Abril 40), 46006 València. Also, original coordinates need correction to ~39.4633/-0.3745 for Ruzafa. School code: 46012197. EXTRAORDINARY HERITAGE: Building designed 1911 by architect Eugenio López in Valencian modernismo tardío style — Bien Inmueble de Etnología. Has its own Wikipedia article and Wikimedia Commons category. Operational from 1915; named 'Jaime Balmes' in 1913. The street C/ Maestro Aguilar is named after Francisco Javier Aguilar Solaz, the school's pre-1863 teacher who died heroically saving students when the original building collapsed on 2 June 1863. SPANISH CIVIL WAR AIR-RAID SHELTER discovered during rehabilitation in early 2000s — visitable in the school courtyard, excellent conservation. Two symmetrical blocks; original Art Nouveau floral ornamentation and inscribed 'Escuelas Nacionales Graduadas Grupo Balmes' rótulo preserved; roof structures similar to Mercado de Colón. Two-line school (PIL + PIP linguistic programmes). PIIE innovation project (conv. 2024). Member of RED PLANEA (national contemporary art + education network). CEPAFD designation. Escolarts dance programme. NOTABLE ALUMNI: Francisco Tomás y Valiente (Constitutional Court president, assassinated by ETA 1996), Julián San Valero Aparisi (archaeologist). Micole 4.7/5 (30 reviews) — positive feedback praising tradition, good installations, and excellent teaching. Buscocolegio has some critical anonymous reviews (noting governance issues) but these should be balanced against the overwhelmingly positive Micole reviews. Active AMPA. The school self-describes as 'inquieta, inclusiva e innovadora — una escuela singular, una escuela especial, una gran escuela pública'.

name: CEIP IVAF–Luis Fortich (Instituto Valenciano de Audiofonología – Colegio Luis Fortich)
type: Public — owned by DIPUTACIÓ DE VALÈNCIA (provincial government), NOT the Generalitat/Conselleria. Subvencionado via convenio with Conselleria de Educación since 1999. Part of IVAF (Instituto Valenciano de Audiofonología), a broader institution providing services for deaf people from birth to old age for 50+ years.
address: C/ Juan de Garay, 23, 46017 València, Valencia, Spain. NOTE: Original address 'C/ de la Guàrdia Civil, 23, 46020' is INCORRECT — not associated with this school. Verified across Diputació de València website, GVA (code 46011831), CNLSE (Centro de Normalización Lingüística de la Lengua de Signos Española), Todoeduca, Micole, Infociudad, and school's own website/Genially presentations. Postal code 46017, not 46020.
neighborhood: Near Patraix district (District Escolar 8: Patraix). The school sits within the broader IVAF campus on C/ Juan de Garay.
founded: 50+ years of institutional history (IVAF has been educating deaf students for over 50 years per Infociudad/Diputació sources, placing origins in the early 1970s or before). The colegio has been named after Luis Fortich and functions as a distinct CEIP within the IVAF complex.
ages: 1 to 12+ years (UNIQUELY offers BOTH 1st cycle Infantil from age 1 AND 2nd cycle Infantil + Primaria. Also has 4 Aulas Específicas (special education units) for deaf students with associated disorders, up to age 14. This is much broader than a typical CEIP.)
stages: 1st Cycle Educación Infantil (ages 1–2 — two aulas, each with a maestra + auxiliar). 2nd Cycle Educación Infantil (ages 3–5). Educación Primaria (ages 6–12). 4 Aulas Específicas de Educación Especial (for deaf students with associated functional diversity — up to age 14). NOTE: Your original data listed only '2º Ciclo Infantil (3-6y); Primaria (6-12y)' — this significantly understates the school's offering.
curriculum: Spanish national curriculum (Valencian Community / LOMLOE). Centro de Integración Preferente para alumnado con deficiencia auditiva (declared Centre for Preferential Integration of deaf students). 3 places reserved per classroom for deaf children from age 1, so inclusion happens from earliest ages. Programa de Educación Plurilingüe with maximum English exposure: Science (1st–6th), Oral English, English, Art & Craft — all taught by qualified English specialists. Programa de Animación Lectora (reading animation): cuentacuentos, workshops, 'Apadrinamiento Lector' (reading godparent) pairing older/younger students; daily individual reading sessions for 5-year-olds, 1st and 2nd year. Proyecto Tablets SNAPPET (1st–6th Primaria) — personalised digital learning in Maths, Valencian, Spanish, and English. Emotional education workshops across all stages. ESCOLES COR BLANQUINEGRE partnership with Fundació Valencia CF (football club foundation). Visited by Valencia CF first-team players (Yunus Musah, Illaix Moriba). A-punt (Valencian TV) visited the school.
languages_day_to_day: Plurilingual programme: Spanish, Valencian, English (Science, Oral English, English, Art & Craft taught in English). PLUS Spanish Sign Language (Lengua de Signos Española / LSE) taught to ALL students — both deaf and hearing — in weekly sessions from age 1 through 6th Primaria and Aulas Específicas.
languages_taught: Spanish, Valencian, English, Spanish Sign Language (LSE)
device_policy_summary: SNAPPET tablets programme for ALL students from 1st to 6th Primaria (Maths, Valencian, Spanish, English). Interactive whiteboards (pizarra digital) in all classrooms. Weekly IT sessions in all courses. Personalised adaptive learning via Snappet platform.
pedagogy: UNIQUE SCHOOL IN VALENCIA: Only public CEIP of preferential integration for deaf students in the province. Owned by Diputació de València, not by the Generalitat — unusual governance. Part of IVAF, a comprehensive institution serving deaf people from 0 months to old age. ALL students (deaf and hearing) learn Spanish Sign Language (LSE) weekly — 'one of its most remarkable projects'. Former deaf student Josep Antoni now teaches LSE at the school. Specialist staff: 4 logopedas (speech therapists), 2 PT (pedagogía terapéutica), 1 psicopedagoga, 1 fisioterapeuta, plus staff trained in augmentative/alternative communication systems and cochlear implants. IVAF also provides: audiology team (audiometric tests, auditory assessments, hearing aid reviews), psychopedagogical counselling service, integration monitoring team, adult deaf education/vocational training, employment insertion for deaf adults, lip-reading rehabilitation. Escuela de Padres (parent school): sign language courses for parents of deaf students, conferences, workshops. Comedor + TRANSPORT escolar (both services available — transport is notable for a city school, reflects catchment beyond immediate neighbourhood). FESORD CV (Valencian Federation of Deaf People) collaboration.
coords_confidence: NEEDS VERIFICATION: Original coordinates 39.48/-0.3608 from GVA directory. Should be checked against actual location of C/ Juan de Garay 23 in the Patraix district area. Approximate correct coordinates: ~39.4585/-0.3880. The original coordinates (39.48/-0.3608) point to an area near Benimaclet/Algirós, which is inconsistent with Patraix/Juan de Garay.
google_rating: ~4.5 (estimated from Google presence; very positive reputation in specialist community)
google_reviews: ~10–20 (estimated; specialist schools have smaller review base)
fees_range: FREE (public school). No tuition fees. Comedor escolar available. Transport escolar available (free for qualifying deaf students — important as catchment is province-wide). All IVAF services are free. Diputació de València provides ~€70,000 annually in grants to associations for deaf and deafblind people.
student_count: Not published. As a centre of preferential integration with 3 reserved deaf places per classroom unit, plus 4 Aulas Específicas, plus 1st cycle Infantil units — estimated ~200–350 students total. Likely smaller than typical CEIPs due to specialist nature and individual attention requirements.
special_notes: CEIP of Preferential Integration for deaf students — UNIQUE in Valencia province. NOTE: YOUR ORIGINAL ADDRESS 'C/ de la Guàrdia Civil, 23, 46020' IS WRONG — the correct address is C/ Juan de Garay 23, 46017 València. Original coordinates also likely incorrect (pointing to Benimaclet area instead of Patraix area). School code: 46011831. Email: luis.fortich@dival.es (Diputació domain). Owned by DIPUTACIÓ DE VALÈNCIA — the only CEIP in this database owned by the provincial government rather than Generalitat or Ayuntamiento. Part of IVAF (Instituto Valenciano de Audiofonología) — a comprehensive institution serving deaf people from birth to old age for 50+ years: audiology, education, adult training, employment insertion, counselling. DISTINCTIVE: ALL students (deaf and hearing) learn Spanish Sign Language from age 1; 3 deaf places reserved per classroom from age 1 for natural early inclusion; specialist staff (4 logopedas, 2 PT, 1 psicopedagoga, 1 fisioterapeuta); Aulas Específicas for deaf students with additional needs; SNAPPET tablet programme (1st–6th); English through Science, Art & Craft; reading animation programme; emotional education workshops; Escoles COR Blanquinegre (Valencia CF Foundation partnership — visited by first-team players); A-punt (Valencian TV) coverage. Micole 4.8/5 (13 reviews) — exceptional rating. Comedor + Transport escolar. Families interested in a uniquely inclusive environment where sign language is normalised for ALL children should consider this school.
